alert.note: Alert for Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:11AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern and northwest Virginia, including the following counties, in northern Virginia, Culpeper and Fauquier. In northwest Virginia, Rappahannock and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Culpeper... Warrenton... Bealeton... Sperryville... The Plains... Hume... Delaplane... New Baltimore... Marshall... Nokesville... Chester Gap... Opal... Remington... Catlett... Calverton... Midland... Flint Hill... Washington... Jeffersonton... Turnbull... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious before sunrise when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
